com.canoo.dolphin.mapping

Interface Property<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the property must be a scalar, not a collection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractProperty, MockedProperty, PropertyImpl

    public interface Property<T>
    Defines a property that can be part of a model (see DolphinBean). Since Java has no native property system this is needed to provide listener / observer support to properties. The public API of Dolphin Platform don't contain an implementation of this interface since the lifecycle of all models must be managed by the BeanManager. By using the Property interface a small Dolphin Platform model will look like this: 
          @DolphinBean
     public class MyModel {


          private Property<String> value;

          public Property<String> valueProperty() {
              return value;
          }
         
     }
    The value can be easily accessed and modified by calling the set(Object) and get() method of the Property but often the model classes provide some convenience methods like shown in the following example: 
          @DolphinBean
     public class MyModel {


          private Property<String> value;

          public Property<String> valueProperty() {
              return value;
          }
         

         public String getValue() {
              return value.get();
         }

         public void setValue(String value) {
              this.value.set(value);
         }
     }
    Currently Dolphin Platform models support only the Property and ObservableList interfaces to define attributes and collections in models. But by just using this 2 interfaces it's easy to create hierarchical models because a Property can contain another bean, for example. The following class shows this design by a simple example: 
          @DolphinBean
     public class MainModel {


          private Property<MyModel> innerModel;

          public Property<MyModel> innerModelProperty() {
              return innerModel;
          }
         
     }
    For more information see DolphinBean

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get()
      Returns the value of the property
      Subscription onChanged(ValueChangeListener<? super T> listener)
      Adds a change listener to the property that will be called whenever the value of the property changes
      void set(T value)
      Sets the value of the property

    • Method Detail

      • set

        void set(T value)
        Sets the value of the property
        Parameters:

        Returns the value of the property
        Returns:
        the current value

      • onChanged
